intro: Flueggea anatolica, commonly known as Anatolian flueggea, is a flowering plant native to regions of Turkey and the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in ecological and horticultural studies.
